title: Casio Kids W215H-2A Classic Digital Stop Watch
features: Blue square resin case and band with buckle closure
Digital display with day and date
description: With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.

Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.

This Casio men's classic digital watch features an intuitive design that makes it easy-to-use. The timepiece is constructed with a durable resin case, a stationary blue resin bezel, and a blue resin band with an adjustable buckle clasp. A durable mineral window shields the square digital-gray dial face, which features a digital time display along with the day and date. The watch also includes an led light, alarm; chronograph and 1/100 second stopwatch adjust buttons that allow you to personalize your watch display. The digital-quartz-powered timepiece is water resistant to 165 feet.
